node.statement:
PROOF STATUS SUMMARY.

CONJECTURE: For all p, q in P_n, 1/Phi_n(r) >= 1/Phi_n(p) + 1/Phi_n(q) where r = p boxplus_n q.

VERDICT BY DEGREE:
  n = 1: TRIVIAL (Phi_1 = 0, convention).
  n = 2: PROVED (equality holds). Complete rigorous proof, all 4 steps VALIDATED.
  n = 3,4,5,10: NUMERICALLY VERIFIED (40,000 random trials, 0 violations).
  General n >= 3: OPEN. Strict inequality expected.

CRITICAL PATH:
  Definitions (1.1)           ESTABLISHED
  Admitted results (1.2-1.3)  ADMITTED (standard literature)
  Base case n=2 (1.4)         PROVED (equality, all VALIDATED)
  Subordination (1.5)         ESTABLISHED (corrected: algebraic not rational)
  Chain rule (1.6)            ESTABLISHED (follows from subordination, 4/6 VALIDATED)
  Main inequality (1.7)       OPEN (Hard Lemma 2, sole remaining gap)

The proof reduces the full conjecture to a single vector inequality involving correction terms from algebraic subordination functions. The gap is isolated, precisely characterized, and the obstruction (non-rationality preventing Herglotz partial-fraction analysis) is well understood.

OVERALL: OPEN for general n. Closing requires new structural insight into algebraic subordination or an entirely different proof technique.
